meanings.definition: Covered in smudges or marks that are difficult to remove.
meanings.sent1: The old book was the smudgiest one in the library.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were the smudgiest after working in the garden all day.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally made the painting smudgiest by touching it too soon.
meanings.sent4: The window looked smudgiest after the kids played outside and pressed their faces against it.
meanings.sent5: The mirror in the bathroom was the smudgiest surface in the house.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of 'smudgy', meaning having a blurred or smeared appearance.
meanings.sent1: Out of all the paintings, hers had the smudgiest look.
meanings.sent2: The smudgiest on the canvas was where the colors blended together.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the smudgiest fingerprint on the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The smudgiest part of the photograph was where the ink had run.
meanings.sent5: The smudgiest area on the map was where the ink had smudged.
